correct_order: Each year, about 31,000 men and women in the U.S. are diagnosed with a cancer caused by an infection from the human papillomavirus, or HPV.
It’s the most common sexually transmitted virus and infection in the U.S.
In women, HPV infection can lead to cervical cancer, which leads to about 4,000 deaths per year.
While in men, it can cause penile cancer.
HPV also causes some cases of oral cancer, cancer of the anus and genital warts.
